author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 3
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 3

segments.pli: 11. Sambodhavagga
segments.en: 11. Awakening

segments.pli: 112. Dutiyanidānasutta
segments.en: 112. Sources (2nd)

segments.pli: “Tīṇimāni, bhikkhave, nidānāni kammānaṃ samudayāya.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are these three sources that give rise to deeds.

segments.pli: Katamāni tīṇi?
segments.en: What three?

segments.pli: Atīte, bhikkhave, chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha chando jāyati;
segments.en: Desire comes up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the past, future, or present.

segments.pli: anāgate, bhikkhave, chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha chando jāyati;
paccuppanne, bhikkhave, chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha chando jāyati.
Kathañca, bhikkhave, atīte chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha chando jāyati?
segments.en: And how does desire come up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the past, future, or present?

segments.pli: Atīte, bhikkhave, chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha cetasā anuvitakketi anuvicāreti.
segments.en: In your heart you think about and consider things that stimulate desire and greed in the past, future, or present.

segments.pli: Tassa atīte chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha cetasā anuvitakkayato anuvicārayato chando jāyati.
segments.en: When you do this, desire comes up,

segments.pli: Chandajāto tehi dhammehi saṃyutto hoti.
segments.en: and you get attached to those things.

segments.pli: Etamahaṃ, bhikkhave, saṃyojanaṃ vadāmi yo cetaso sārāgo.
segments.en: This lust in the heart is what I call a fetter.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, atīte chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha chando jāyati.
segments.en: That’s how desire comes up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the past, future, or present.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, anāgate chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha chando jāyati?
Anāgate, bhikkhave, chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha cetasā anuvitakketi anuvicāreti.
Tassa anāgate chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha cetasā anuvitakkayato anuvicārayato chando jāyati.
Chandajāto tehi dhammehi saṃyutto hoti.
Etamahaṃ, bhikkhave, saṃyojanaṃ vadāmi yo cetaso sārāgo.
Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, anāgate chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha chando jāyati.
Kathañca, bhikkhave, paccuppanne chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha chando jāyati?
Paccuppanne, bhikkhave, chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha cetasā anuvitakketi anuvicāreti.
Tassa paccuppanne chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha cetasā anuvitakkayato anuvicārayato chando jāyati.
Chandajāto tehi dhammehi saṃyutto hoti.
Etamahaṃ, bhikkhave, saṃyojanaṃ vadāmi yo cetaso sārāgo.
Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, paccuppanne chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha chando jāyati.
Imāni kho, bhikkhave, tīṇi nidānāni kammānaṃ samudayāya.
segments.en: These are three sources that give rise to deeds.

segments.pli: Tīṇimāni, bhikkhave, nidānāni kammānaṃ samudayāya.
segments.en: There are these three sources that give rise to deeds.

segments.pli: Katamāni tīṇi?
segments.en: What three?

segments.pli: Atīte, bhikkhave, chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha chando na jāyati;
segments.en: Desire doesn’t come up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the past, future, or present.

segments.pli: anāgate, bhikkhave, chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha chando na jāyati;
paccuppanne, bhikkhave, chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha chando na jāyati.
Kathañca, bhikkhave, atīte chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha chando na jāyati?
segments.en: And how does desire not come up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the past, future, or present?

segments.pli: Atītānaṃ, bhikkhave, chandarāgaṭṭhāniyānaṃ dhammānaṃ āyatiṃ vipākaṃ pajānāti.
segments.en: You understand the future result of things that stimulate desire and greed in the past, future, or present.

segments.pli: Āyatiṃ vipākaṃ viditvā tadabhinivatteti.
segments.en: When you know this, you grow disillusioned,

segments.pli: Tadabhinivattetvā cetasā abhinivijjhitvā paññāya ativijjha passati.
segments.en: your heart becomes dispassionate, and you see it with penetrating wisdom.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, atīte chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha chando na jāyati.
segments.en: That’s how desire doesn’t come up for things that stimulate desire and greed in the past, future, or present.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, anāgate chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha chando na jāyati?
Anāgatānaṃ, bhikkhave, chandarāgaṭṭhāniyānaṃ dhammānaṃ āyatiṃ vipākaṃ pajānāti.
Āyatiṃ vipākaṃ viditvā tadabhinivatteti.
Tadabhinivattetvā cetasā abhinivijjhitvā paññāya ativijjha passati.
Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, anāgate chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha chando na jāyati.
Kathañca, bhikkhave, paccuppanne chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha chando na jāyati?
Paccuppannānaṃ, bhikkhave, chandarāgaṭṭhāniyānaṃ dhammānaṃ āyatiṃ vipākaṃ pajānāti, āyatiṃ vipākaṃ viditvā tadabhinivatteti, tadabhinivattetvā cetasā abhinivijjhitvā paññāya ativijjha passati.
Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, paccuppanne chandarāgaṭṭhāniye dhamme ārabbha chando na jāyati.
Imāni kho, bhikkhave, tīṇi nidānāni kammānaṃ samudayāyā”ti.
segments.en: These are three sources that give rise to deeds.”

segments.pli: Dasamaṃ.
Sambodhavaggo paṭhamo.
Pubbeva duve assādā,
Samaṇo ruṇṇapañcamaṃ;
Atitti dve ca vuttāni,
Nidānāni apare duveti.

sections.title: “Mendicants, there are these three sources that give rise…

suttaplex.blurb: Sources of deeds: past, present, future.
